items.content:
Information Security Analyst

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Education Technology, eLearning, Non-Profit
Company size: 201-500 people
Company: Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. | San Francisco, CA

Remote details

Office Location: San Francisco, CA. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

security
threat-model

Job description

Summary

We are looking for a smart security practitioner with an interest in large scale systems. You understand the importance of testing and documentation, and common pitfalls in developing secure web applications. You must have a passion for the WMF mission. We do (almost) everything publicly, and volunteers can add arbitrary JavaScript to our site. That should both frighten and thrill you.

Privacy is one of the core values of the Wikimedia Foundation and you will be joining the team responsible for providing technical and governance security solutions to ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of Wikimedia applications.  This is your opportunity to participate in and provide security and privacy solutions so together we can create a world in which everyone can freely share in the sum of all knowledge.  

This is what you will be doing:

  • Review security controls, policies and procedures and provide recommendations for the adaption of new technologies or policies.  
  • Conduct internal and external security audits
  • Provide support for security incidents or events
  • Evaluate current organizational risk and threat profile
  • Identify improvement areas and provide organization wide security awareness training.  
  • Work with teams to ensure they make safe, compliant, design and architectural decisions
  • Participate in privacy initiatives
  • Participate in operational security initiatives

You’ll need these skills and experience:

  • 5+ years experience as part of an Information Security team
  • CISSP/GIAC
  • Experience in policy creation and enforcement
  • Experience with Threat Modeling and Risk Assessments
  • Experience in Incident Response
  • Bachelor’s degree in CS or related field or the equivalent in work related experience

Pluses

  • Wikimedia community experience
  • Interest in/passion for all things open source

The Wikimedia Foundation is... 

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

Benefits & Perks *

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

* for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by location

More information

WMF

Blog

Annual Report - 2017

Wikimedia 2030



Apply now

About Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.

The Wikimedia Foundation is...

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

Benefits

  • Fully paid premiums for medical, dental & vision insurance premiums
  • 401(k) with 4% matching contribution
  • 7-12 weeks parental leave with 100% pay + lactation room
  • Wellness Program ($1800 annual) to promote wellness & personal growth
  • Pre-tax savings plans for Transportation & Parking
  • Flexible work schedules and remote working options
  • Pet Friendly office
  • Commitment to diversity & inclusion throughout the employee lifecycle
  • 12 days vacation, 19 days holiday, 2 days volunteer work and more!
  • Lean more at https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Work_with_us

items.title: Sr. Route Optimization Engineer at Clevertech
items.content:
Sr. Route Optimization Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

routes
mathematical-optimization
implementation

Job description

### DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces.

### REQUIREMENTS

* You love doing puzzles
* You have serious math skills
* You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
* You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
* You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings

Apply now

About Clevertech

BENEFITS Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source

Marketing/Growth Hacker at Knack

Earth, United States, Remote · Full Time
We do things a little differently and we like it that way. Our team is close-knit, highly-engaged, 100% remote, and dedicated to building a world-class product striving to democratize data and app building. Read More

We do things a little differently and we like it that way. Our team is close-knit, highly-engaged, 100% remote, and dedicated to building a world-class product striving to democratize data and app building.

We're looking for some kindred spirits to join us on this crazy ride.

Find out more at:
https://www.knack.com/work-at-knack

Applied
Apply to Knack
Add a message to Knack
Apply

Job Description

We’re looking for a marketing and growth hacker to help drive Knack's efforts in identifying markets and executing growth initiatives.

We've been managing growth but now it's time to start accelerating!

This position will straddle the traditional marketing world, SEO and Adwords, and the new techniques of growth-hacking, with a heavy emphasis on data and analysis to run experiments and validate hypotheses.

What You'll Do
- Understand Knack users and the competitive market landscape.
- Know the product roadmap and market trends intimately to help devise, plan, and execute strategies and tactics in additional to product launches, to drive awareness and new trials of Knack.
- Manage online marketing efforts including SEO and content marketing.
- Manage the execution of marketing tactics to support audience-specific strategies—everything from blogs, infographics, videos, tweets to landing page messaging – we want you to think outside the box.

What We’re Looking For
- A deep understanding of SaaS analytical numbers like LTV, CAC, Churn, etc.
- Experience in online marketing areas like SEO, content marketing, and PPC campaigns.
- Demonstrated customer focus, with an ability to understand, simplify, and communicate complex ideas
￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼- Analytical skills: analyze user data and implement appropriate tracking to measure marketing success
- A desire to be a part of a long-term, profitable business that makes a great product loved by thousands of customers.

About Knack

Knack is a no-code platform that makes it easy for anyone to build applications and workflows to do amazing things with their data.

Knack launched in 2012 and has been growing steadily as we’ve built our team, perfected our product, and nailed our product-market fit. We’re now ready to take things to the next level and maximize the opportunity for what this product can be.

So why are we different?

We’re bootstrapped: we’ve had to build something our customers actually pay for. This changes how you do things.

We’re 100% remote: and have been from the beginning. Every decision we’ve made has been based around optimizing our remote operations.

We’re small: and we like it that way. We’re more than just chat avatars-- we’ve all gotten to know each other, have grown together, and love working with each other.

We enjoy the journey: we’re in this for the long haul. We’re not chasing an exit or the next round of funding. We’re building something we’re proud of and want to keep improving on.

You can read more about Knack and the team here.

Benefits & Compensation

Define your work: our only rule is our overlap zone of 11am to 4pm EST. Otherwise find the location, environment, and schedule that is best for your life and work. It’s not about separation, it’s about optimization.

Unlimited Paid Vacation: take the time you need to stay motivated, charged, and balanced. You’ll get forced days off for birthdays and knackiversaries.

Paid Corporate Retreats: we get together twice a year at amazing locations to do normal human being things in person. We pay for your flight, lodging, and meals.

Learning Credits: an annual allowance is provided to stay on top of your game with classes, books, and conferences.

HealthCare: we offer health, vision, and dental, covering 75% of the premium for you and your dependents (spouse + children).

Skills
Analytics & Reporting, Product Marketing, SaaS, Conversion Optimization, A/B Testing, Landing Page Optimization, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Funnel Optimization
Compensation
$85K–$110K
0.5%–2.5%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

What We're Building

Knack enables non-programmers to do amazing things with their data. It's the central hub that makes it easy to do something useful with all of your data.

Knack starts with storing your data in a simple online database. You can then build simple web apps using search, forms, tables, and more to display, update, and share that data. These apps make it easy to manage and analyze the data, build workflows, share it with other users, and integrate it with other services.

Apps can be published to any site and adapt to the surrounding design. Multiple versions can be published to different sites and for different audiences.

Developers can extend these apps with a RESTful API, custom CSS, and JS event handlers.

items.title: Sr. Route Optimization Engineer
items.content:
Sr. Route Optimization Engineer

Company: Clevertech

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces.

REQUIREMENTS

  • You love doing puzzles
  • You have serious math skills
  • You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
  • You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
  • You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travelers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself

You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here. And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag

And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over Slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.
Clevertech Culture Video

How to apply:
hire.clevertech.biz/job/5b2be18e62c05c001b2000b0

Company: Clevertech

DESCRIPTION:

Clevertech is looking for an organized and efficient Product Success Assistant to join our worldwide team. We are looking for a team member to help us set the best practices and define success for various projects while working with Project Managers and other members of the product team. We have been at this for seventeen years, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people. This position is only available to individuals living in the USA or Canada.

Do you have an interest in tech? Do you love discovering new apps and their endless possibilities?

Our vision at Clevertech is to provide ambitious startups and enterprises a world class development team that executes on their most ambitious goals. The ideal candidate will have a willingness to learn. This is a position where experience is a plus, but a genuine interest in learning about new technologies will go a long way. Attention to detail, a dynamic approach and communication skills are highly desired.

REQUIREMENTS:

You have a consistently positive attitude and are interested in learning new things. Excellent communication (verbal and written), analytical, and interpersonal skills are you best strengths and you are able to work independently and within a team to take on new tasks as needed. Prioritization and organization will be key factors of success in this role.

  • 3+ years experience in testing, manual and/or automation a plus.
  • Attention to Detail
  • Organization
  • Ability to multitask
  • Ability to effectively prioritize
  • Strategic Planning
  • Daily Management Update
  • Willingness to learn

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Digital Marketer

Worldwide
Company: Doubledot Media

FULL-TIME

Overview

Doubledot Media is a New Zealand-based company creating online tools and training for people looking to start their own online businesses. We’re based in Christchurch, but the majority of our team work remotely from various places around the world. (Living in the future FTW!)

We’re on the hunt for a talented digital marketer with a passion for all forms of online marketing to help grow our organic traffic and market to existing customers.

Our new digital marketer will play a vital role in looking for new growth opportunities, maintaining ‘best practices’ both on and off site, providing guidance to our content team and generally making sure our search efforts are top notch.

We’re looking for someone with a fair amount of cleverness, the ability to Get Things Done, and a genuine passion and love for search marketing.

You’ll be responsible for:

  • Coming up with creative content and link building ideas and methods to increase our organic traffic.
  • On-page optimisations and site audits.
  • Running email marketing campaigns.
  • Site usability studies and research.
  • Examining ways to improve user experience and coming up with product recommendations.

You’ll need:

  • Excellent written English and a friendly manner in writing.
  • Meticulous attention to detail. Your spelling and grammar should be top notch.
  • Good time management skills. Since this can be a remote working position, you’ll need to be organized, motivated, and (dare we say) a “self-starter”.
  • Have been involved in search marketing or link building campaigns.
  • Love analytics and metrics, because they show off your superb talent.
  • Know how to moderate content and build a powerful online brand.

Neat things about working with us:

  • Flexible hours
  • Work from home (or from our Christchurch office)
  • Relaxed, ego-free, family-friendly work culture
  • Need a few more reasons? Read what current and former staff have to say…

If you’d like to come work in our Christchurch office in Ferrymead, you also get:

  • Weekly Friday BBQ (or sushiBQ, or ThaiBQ)
  • Novelty coffee mugs
  • An extremely comfortable chair
  • Tap dancing seagulls

How to apply

We’re going to level with you here: We usually get a lot of applications, and a lot of them are not very inspiring.

We’re looking for people with good problem-solving skills, good communication skills, and the willingness to go the extra mile, so here’s what you need to do.

  1. Record a short (1 – 2 minute) cover letter video and upload it somewhere where we can see it. Tell us a little bit about yourself, search tools and sites you commonly use and why you think you’d be great for this role.
  2. Create an email for jobs@doubledotmedia.com (Subject: Digital Marketing Position)
  3. Give us the link to your video inside the email
  4. Attach your CV/resume in PDF format
  5. Send

Apply for job

items.content:
Email Marketing Manager

Company: PLAE

THE CANDIDATE
We are looking for an Email Marketing Manager who will be responsible for keeping our CRM and Email database organized and well fed. Although there are a foundation and framework in place, this position will have the autonomy to shape and improve the future of it. This is why the candidate must be ambitious and driven, ready to give it their all every single day.

- The candidate appreciates design and will be expected to create engaging emails and campaigns that are consistent with our brand.

- “That’s the way it’s always been done” is not a phrase you will hear with our team. This candidate gets excited about finding new ways to improve an existing system or implement new ones. If there’s a problem, fix it!

- This candidate has a high attention to detail when it comes to writing copy. The first draft is never the final draft.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Manage our CRM and email (MailChimp) database.
  • Building and growing our email marketing base.
  • Creating intricate and dynamic email campaigns to engage or re-engage our audience.
  • Consistently segmenting our email lists to create fully engaging campaigns.
  • Importing lists from tradeshows and other events, subscribing them to the correct content.
  • Scanning our CRM (which has an integration with MailChimp) to engage existing customers in new campaigns.
  • Proofreading emails for clarity, grammar, and spelling
  • Create and manage email templates using graphics, merge-tag personalization, and other advanced features
  • Creating mobile-friendly email templates
  • Creating reports to compare subscribes, unsubscribes, and other related metrics.
  • Holding regular scrums with our sales and marketing team to make sure all available content is being sent out.
  • Ensure emails follow industry policies, best practices, and GDPR laws.

LOCATION
This position is remote. However, the candidate will regularly report to our team in Woodstock, GA (U.S. Eastern Timezone), via video conference.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • 2+ years of email marketing experience (This is not limited to having worked directly in an email marketing role).
  • Knowledge of marketing testing, data analysis, and reporting.
  • Experience with CRM systems and marketing automation tools (we use MailChimp).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong organization and problem-solving skills.
  • Basic HTML/CSS markup skills
  • Adobe Creative Suite (specifically Photoshop and Illustrator).
  • Knowledge of using automation tools like Zapier.
  • Understanding of email marketing operations and technology, including workflows, and triggered events.

COMPENSATION & HOURS
This position will start on a contract basis at $20 an hour for 20-30 hours a week. It will be given a three-month trial period, after which we’ll decide if you’re the right fit to bring you on full-time as an employee.

APPLICATION
  • Send us an intro about you
  • Dust off your LinkedIn profile and send us the link.
  • Take some time to peruse reallygoodemails.com. Send us two of your favorite emails and tell us what you appreciate about them.
  • Send your application in an email (bonus points if it's HTML) to emailmarketing@plae.us

THE TEAM
Our marketing team is a close-knit group of polymaths who wear multiple hats. Most of us don’t have degrees in our field of work, but that has never stopped us from pursuing our best work, each and every day. We eat lunch together, attend Creative Mornings together, and have monthly Photoshop battles. We’re building a foundation each day, which makes our job so exciting.

ABOUT PLAE
We’re PLAE, an innovative company that designs the world's most advanced sports flooring.

In 2009, we launched our business on the principle that reliable athletic flooring is a key element of any training space, offering safer sessions and boosted performance. We sought to push the boundaries of the status quo, to develop concepts previously overlooked, to collaborate with coaches and athletes around the world in our pursuit of daily progress.

Our goal has been to equip athletes for the grind, engaging them in a shared challenge to push through resistance, ignoring the naysayers, and pursuing improvement.

We have spent the years since our genesis innovating fresh ways to push the envelope, giving back to the groups that have embraced us, shining a light on greatness wherever we discover it, approaching each day like a chance to improve.

We love what we do.
How to apply:
In an email, send us: an intro about you and include your LinkedIn profile link. Take some time to peruse reallygoodemails.com and send us two of your favorite emails and tell us what you appreciate about them. Put all of these elements together in an email (bonus points if it's HTML) to emailmarketing@plae.us.

From humble beginnings, SailChecker has been coined the Hotels.com of the sailing industry, so called because of their successful attempt to aggregate all the available certified yachts worldwide. From humble beginnings, SailChecker has been coined the Hotels.com of the sailing industry, so called because of their successful attempt to aggregate all the available certified yachts worldwide. These endeavors, however, are only the start of a passion led journey to disrupt the yacht charter market by focusing on one thing - cusomer peace of mind.

We examined every element of the sailing experience to establish exactly where expectations lay and how they could be exceeded. Price motivates many, this was an obvious start point. Thus SailChecker will never be beaten on an honest price. Yet this is not the battle we are looking to fight and win.

Right now there are few tools available to help customers discriminate between yachts beyond the age and price of the boat. Yet our research showed that there were so many features of the perfect charter.

Job Description

ABOUT OUR COMPANY:
We are an early stage company consisting of industry experts in ecommerce, mobile technology, and software and have experience working for both startups and Fortune 500 companies. The founders are a dynamic group of motivated professionals with 20+ years (each) of valuable experience in technology, management consulting, PR, and marketing. This is an exciting opportunity for an ideal go-getter to be part of a new B2B software offering which includes an innovative SaaS platform and multiple mobile apps that are about to revolutionize the billion dollar national and international market of next-generation freelancers and small business owners. The product helps service-oriented businesses streamline their revenue, marketing, and customer engagements in today’s on-demand, always connected culture. We are building a company that we believe, with the proper team in place, could be the next Uber or the next Salesforce.com. We are vigilantly searching for seed to series A funding!

The Right Profile
We are looking for a professional fund raiser who can accelerate our vision of going viral with our offering! The ideal candidate must have 3-5 years of working with mobile, ecommerce, and software companies; specifically, the candidate must have experience with dealing with intelligent early stage investors to VC and a good track record helping raise funding from VCs.

Key Functions:
- Collaborate with our executive team to clearly define funding goals
- Identify and pursue investors
- Participate in regular investor pitch meetings to assist with securing crucial funding rounds
- Work directly with the CEO
- Help introduce the right investors and and close funds

Qualifications:
- Previous related experience required, professional services experience or investor relations experience
- Experience in starting technology companies
- Excellent communication, verbal and written skills

items.content:
Go to our website to find more information about:
* How to apply (YOU CAN ONLY OFFICIALLY APPLY THERE - LOOK FOR THE PAGE "OPEN POSITIONS")
* Why join us
* Our general requirements

This is a unique opportunity for you to work at a fast-growing online startup, alongside a purposeful, passionate, international and welcoming team. It's a chance to put your passion and knowledge of product management, product design, prototyping and development into practice and impact the future of innovative industries such as RetailTech, HealthTech, EnergyTech and TransportationTech. We are looking for a resourceful and enthusiastic expert to lead our product development.

We are looking for a high-performance team player-Is this You?
* Broad and deep technology knowledge, business acumen and experience with development of innovative tech solutions.
* Extensive experience in product development to achieve an organisational vision and business goals.
* Capacity to both ask and answer key questions regarding technology, to lead the choice of technology in relation to the business strategy, available resources and trends, including the ability to help the team visualize the possibilities.
* Ability to balance a strategic outlook with an extremely hands-on approach in coding and development.
* Proven hands-on experience and record of developing products.
* Ability to maintain an innovation-driven mindset and provide critical inputs for product creation.
* Ability to perform analysis and hands-on design with respect to innovative and patentable algorithms.
* Passionate about prototyping, product design, developing, QA and beyond.
* Experience with prototyping tools, e.g. InVision, typeform, IFTTT, Zapier, python, etc.
* Front-end development knowledge and experience.
* Back-End Development experience and knowledge.

We would love if you have the following too
* Capacity to identify market requirements, define the product vision in collaboration with the team, create preliminary architecture, design concepts and shape the product roadmap for the platform.
* Capacity to empathize with the end users and bring insights that translate into robustness of our platform, through exceptional UX and cost-efficiency.
* Great product management skills, the capacity to successfully deal with complexity, unpredictability and changes alongside the ability to prioritise and delegate work.
* Ability to keep a lean approach and gracefully adapt the product roadmap to the changing needs of the organisation and the environment.
* Idea generator and strategist when it comes to technology optimisation.
* Drive to keep an eye on technology and the competitive landscape to stay ahead of the trends and competition alongside.

YOU CAN ONLY OFFICIALLY APPLY ON OUR WEBSITE - LOOK FOR THE PAGE "OPEN POSITIONS" AND FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS THERE. THANK YOU.

items.content:
Product Owner

Company: Novate IT Ltd
Location: Cwmbran
Permanent

Product Owner - iOS , Android - Cwmbran

A brand new role with a highly successful and growing employer in South Wales for a Product Owner to work across a variety of video - centric projects for their platform. A generous starting salary is offered plus benefits such as up to 10% bonus, flexi time, a 25 day holiday allowance that will increase with service, life assurance, 3% employee 6% employer initial pension package and private health care.

The company have several applications that are used by consumers on a global scale across both mobile and web platforms, these applications handle huge amounts of data with no downtime or stress on their systems. They are now looking to hire a Product Owner to help drive product development with local and remote scrum teams.

You will have experience of working in an Agile environment helping local and remote teams of cross-functional developers understand user stories and promote the company's product vision. You will be working on iOS and Android projects so you must have knowledge of both. You will also be able to balance utilising good functionality, user experience and product design. On the technical side solid experience of understanding test automation, continuous integration and deployment as well as evaluating current engineering standards and suggesting improvements is essential. Any experience of working on a video streaming, digital television, media player or similar project will be a huge benefit. As you will be interacting with a huge variety of users, developers and managers excellent communication skills are extremely important.

If you're looking to step up into a Product Owner role or grow further from your current job, joining an established company who are looking to improve their user's experience through new innovative products across iOS and Android then send in your CV today!

Novate IT Ltd is a leading supplier of permanent and contract recruitment services for companies in the IT, Digital Media and Telecommunications industries.

items.title: Product Manager Trainee
items.content:
Who is the MOST inspiring person you know? What have they ACHIEVED that you really admire? Wouldn’t it be great if they would share their success secrets with YOU?

The obvious answer - YES - prompted us to embark on our mission, aiming to improve 10 million lives by 2022. By creating marketing campaigns, launching digital products or coaching our clients, PASSION.IO gives inspiring people the platform they deserve to share their message with the world and impact lives.

We are an international team with the majority of our customers in the US. We’ve grown from nothing to multi-million dollar business in under 2 years… because when you focus on impact, income will follow. We work together to not only make this company successful, but to transform our clients, our customers and ourselves into our best versions.

As we say, Do it with Passion, or not at all.

Do you think you’re the right fit?

We’ve created a software-as-a-service that allows you to build and launch native mobile apps with just a few clicks.

We are looking for an inspiring, engaged and motivated new member of our Product/IT team.

You want to become a great product manager with the vision to change the future of learning.

Your mission will be to define and further develop ground-breaking software-as-a-services and mobile apps for our partners and customers that bring the Passion.io learning experience to the next level and to millions of people anytime, anywhere.

*What you'll be working on*
* Supporting the Product Owner
# You will be assigned to the product owner who will be your mentor during the entire program
# You will drive focus product projects to leverage and bond with your mentor
# Define, structure, develop processes and tools, and show measurable results
* Benchmarking Products incl. UX/UI
# You work on product development while consistently sounding out the market to help refine the product while monitoring and optimizing key performance indicators (KPIs)
# You will have ideas for further developing our products, have a clear idea about the future product, and how it will transform the market
# You will successfully drive projects/features through the lifecycle from conception to launch
# Setting up and conducting UX tests and improve the platform
* Kanban / Scrum
# You are going to develop and prioritize product roadmaps
# Thus you are taking care of the product backlogs and prioritize them accordingly
# As part of this role you organize and set goals for sprints
# You are in charge of the technical demands of the product and make sure to motivate all stakeholders towards a common goal
* Design Thinking / Customer Obsession
# Be the user-advocate during the development process, subjecting early-stage designs to usability testing or expert review, and offering implementation suggestions from a user-centred perspective
# You keep functionality, usability, performance and quality of the product in mind
# You are in contact with customers and users to learn from them and optimize their problems
* Prep project for your new role
# In this module, you will identify and implement a complex project that prepares you for your new role

*What you'll bring to the team*
# You have first experiences with kanban and/or scrum and successfully operated sprints before
# You worked in start-ups in the product department
# You have got experience of working at the intersection of business and technology and have a basic understanding of IT infrastructure
# You are hands on and look for pragmatic solutions
# You are good at keeping the bigger picture in mind and can thus organize yourself and your team
# You have strong cross-functional communication skills

*What we offer you*
# Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

items.title: Product Launch Manager Trainee
items.content:
Who is the MOST inspiring person you know? What have they ACHIEVED that you really admire? Wouldn’t it be great if they would share their success secrets with YOU?

The obvious answer - YES - prompted us to embark on our mission, aiming to improve 10 million lives by 2022. By creating marketing campaigns, launching digital products or coaching our clients, PASSION.IO gives inspiring people the platform they deserve to share their message with the world and impact lives.

We are an international team with the majority of our customers in the US. We’ve grown from nothing to multi-million dollar business in under 2 years… because when you focus on impact, income will follow. We work together to not only make this company successful, but to transform our clients, our customers and ourselves into our best versions.

As we say, *Do it with Passion, or not at all.*

Do you think you’re the right fit?

This training program trains top talent in launching digital products globally. Program candidates will gain inside perspectives, drive day-to-day management and build deep functional expertise by rotating every 3-6 months to new functional stages with different challenges.

Duration: 15 months total, fast track: 12months depending on exceptional performance

Alumni will then build verticals globally from scratch to market leadership or become a key player in functions such as online marketing, product development, sales and operations.

You are responsible to excel in 6 modules. Modules can be conducted abroad if reasonable. During the program, you will be assigned to a mentor you report to on a bi-weekly basis and direct responsible individuals (DRIs) for each program stage where you lead diverse projects to lift Passion’s business.

*What you'll be working on*
* Assisting a senior launcher
# You will be assigned to a senior launcher who will be your mentor during the entire program
# You will drive focus projects to leverage and bond with your mentor
# Define, structure, develop processes and tools, and show measurable results
*Product
# You work on product development while consistently sounding out the market to help refine the product while monitoring and optimizing key performance indicators (KPIs)
# You will have ideas for further developing the business model, have a clear idea about the product, and how it will transform the market

# You will support implementing the launch strategy and its roadmap across markets / verticals
# You will keep a close eye on the market, competition and use your research to continuously improve marketing activities
*Celebrity Key Account
# You will work with clients, including larger celebrities and partnerships
# You will identify opportunities to further improve the relationship, streamline operations and share best practices across markets
*Prep project for your new role

# Are an extremely well structured thinker with a clear passion for action & results
# Have experience in managing complex processes, projects, and are an expert communicator
# Love data, numbers & have excellent analytical skills, experience with quantitative & qualitative research – all paired with demonstrated experience of turning data into actionable insights
# Fluent in English

*What we offer you*

# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

Lead Engineer/Data Engineer/Technical Product Manager at Biome Analytics

San Francisco, Chicago, Remote · Full Time

Next generation of clinical performance applications that help doctors and hospitals deliver better cardiovascular care to more patients at a lower cost.

Applied
Apply to Biome Analytics
Add a message to Biome Analytics
Apply

Job Description

We build clinical performance applications that help doctors and hospitals deliver better care to more patients at a lower cost. To do this, we aggregate deep clinical and financial data from our clients, build propitiatory measures and and benchmarks, and use ML techniques to identify high impact clinical and financial improvement opportunities. We are a self funded startup with prestigious clients who are all reference-able. We have proven our concepts and are now looking to hire talent to scale our business.

We seek a leader who can manage and evolve our data pipeline, and serve as a technical product manager.

Qualified candidates should have at least 2 years of database and data pipeline experience, and have working knowledge of SQL, data modelling, SPARK, ETL/ELT orchestration tools, and have familiarity with machine learning models.

Compensation
$120K–$160K
0.25%–0.75%

Biome builds the clinical performance applications that clinical leaders need to do their best work. Our first products are focused on cardiovascular care and our early clients include top academic medical centers in California and New York.

We deliver discrete products for Cardiac Surgery, Interventional Cardiology, Electrophysiology, Structural Heart, Congenital Heart. We also provide proprietary benchmarks and modules that deliver clinician target performance profiles, contract risk management, and performance and throughput simulation.

Early Clients that have partnered with Biome to successfully transition to "value based care" delivery have achieved as much as a 2X ROI in their first year "on Biome".

GM India - Product, Sales, Marketing, & Evangelism Job at Crowdera - AngelList
  • Crowdera
  • Product
  • Jobs

Applied

GM India - Product, Sales, Marketing, & Evangelism at Crowdera

India, Mumbai, Nagpur, Remote · Full Time

Probably there are a million ways to build promising career, but nothing beats being part of a compassion driven economy where abundance starts with giving. Crowdera has created world’s first truly free fundraising platform that does not charge any commission or ask for tip from donors. We are changing the way people give and align themselves with the causes and individuals they fund & support. Our continuos evolution will help fundraisers to add sustenance to their organizations, improve their lives, make a lasting impact. What we are set to achieve in next few years will make you fall in love with us. Plus, you get to work with & mentored by silicon valley business leaders and tech gurus with pedigree of eBay, Amazon, Google, Columbia. Ask us and we will give 10 more reasons to work with us.

Applied
Apply to Crowdera
Add a message to Crowdera
Apply

Job Description

As GM India, you will report directly to the founder and will be part of core management team. Your sole purpose is to set-up a strong presence of Crowdera in India by evangelizing, and to progress the vision of the company through action on the ground. You have to a self-starter, build the Indian operations ground up, evangelize & scale Crowdera's brand among all business associates and partners – philanthropists, social entrepreneurs, high net worth donors & investors, corporates, celebrities or government officials.

In this demanding and multidimensional role, you will serve as a trusted aide to the founder on planning and execution of all matters pertaining to Crowdera’s India operations.

Success in this role will be defined by your ability to think both strategically and tactically, exercise good judgment, build and manage excellent relations with clients, lead team and numerous assignments with perfection in a fast-paced and creative environment.

Responsibilities
- Evangelize Crowdera vision and mission within India.
- Spearhead the customer development & customer fundraising success.
- Build partnerships with large corporations, public sector, third sector, foundations, celebrity circuit, and HNIs in APAC.
- Lead sales and corporate development in corporate giving space and fundraising space.
- Keep track of new legislative developments on CSR and trends in Corporate Giving.
- Build & manage India team. Be responsible for all HR functions and beyond– morale, motivation, performance, hiring, retention, termination.

Skills
Business Development, Corporate Development, Product Marketing, Non-Profit Experience, Customer Development, Social Media Marketing, Press Outreach, Social Entrepreneurship, Sales and Marketing, Executive Leadership, Crowdfunding, Social Media Strategy, Corporate Social Responsibility, Corporate and Marketing Strategy, Non-Profit Fundraising, Press and Corporate Communications, Nonprofit Management, Philanthropy, Celebrity/Influencer Outreach, Employee Engagement and CSR activities

What We're Building

Crowdera is a cloud-based fundraising platform and offers a comprehensive fundraising framework for non-profits and social innovators to raise funds without any form of donor dippings. It facilitates all aspects of the online fundraising ecosystem including donation buttons, cross-site donation widgets, websites (CMS), P2P campaigns, donation management, and much more.

Crowdera complements nonprofit's existing fundraising activities and helps them to increase their overall funding & impact by offering a user-friendly, fee-free platform to create visually compelling, viral team fundraising campaigns that help them build meaningful engagement, spread their messages, and expand their donor base.

Crowdera is building a very simple and scalable technology driven business model that would help corporations, fundraisers & Crowdera to be successful at the same time.

Social media marketing at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

We have grown over the past year to be one of the leading online platforms for indian short films and stories. Our films have been watched by thousands of audience and you have the opportunity to engage and build our passionate community!

You will be part of our core team, working closely with our founders, editor and content manager. Your key goal will be to grow new audience by community building – to engage with our audience and foster the relationships to reach their networks.

The role will include, but not limited to:
– Communicate with our audience using our social media (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, etc), email and chat channels
_ Answer to quora questions
_ Tweet with our #shortfundly hashtags.
_ Manage facebook fan page
_ Add our short films into pinterest page
_ Talking to film festival facebook pages event organizers in facebook.
– Using analytic tools to understand our audience
– Manage publisher syndication to extend our community outreach online
– Community engagement offline

Perks of working at Shortfundly:

– Watching video/ short films/ viral content is part of the job
– Interacting with filmmakers/ artists/ models is part of the job
– Discussing film stories/ brainstorming on scripts/ creating videos is part of the job

If you are interested, please write to: support@shortfundly.com with your brief self introduction, name and contact number. Share your linkedin profile .

Marketing at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

Shortfundly would be place for you, if you love the following in any particular order:
a. Movies
b. Marketing
c. Startup culture

Shortfundly.com is creating a digital revolution in Shortfilm Industry. The online shortfilm sharing portal (shortfundly) start collecting 22,000+ short films to different shortfilm categories from new age filmmakers. This portal will also use its contacts to promote the films in the shortfilm festival circuit. Shortfundly shares plenty of new films every day. We are planning for big expansions in the future into other languages. We are bootstrap company. So, you are not only part of team, you are part of the company.

We are looking for a “Superstar” Marketing who take this to 100,000 customers within one year. If you are looking a challenge and ready to chase numbers, this could be it. We won't offer any salary hikes or comfy office, but we offer a great role with full ownership and grow with the company.

Roles
- Increase customer acquisition through Online and Offline marketing
- Strong experience towards Digital Marketing
- Bring in new ideas and execute them
- Tracking and managing marketing campaigns
- Sell the product with positioning not with discounts
- Create a buzz around the brand Shortfundly
- Scaling the marketing team along with business requirements

Requirements
- Worked on B2C brand before in marketing
- Examples of successful marketing campaigns executed
- Managed teams and interacted across levels
- Knowledge of Tamil and/or other Southern Languages would be a plus

Lets us know in 3 to 5 lines, why you are a Superstar “Marketer” in your email to be considered. Mail to support@shortfundly.com.

Skills
Marketing, Branding, Product Marketing, Sales and Marketing, Digital Marketing, Marketing and Branding, Marketing & Branding, Marketing Management, Digital Marketing and Branding

Job Description

Do you enjoy watching films? Does learning new things excite you? Are you curious about the world around you? Are you a communicator?

We’re looking for content/ marketing interns to join shortfundly, which has grown in over a year from just an idea to being one of Asia’s leading online short film promotion platform.

The applicant should also:
– loves films, people, technology
– loves, eats and breathe social media
– have basic skills in Photoshop, Word processing
– based in chennai/kerala/hyderabad/Mumbai/Anywhere in South central Asia (India / sri lanka / Singapore / Malaysia)

Responsibilities:
_ Write blog post about our platform product / short films / film festival events
_ Share this & put content marketing techniques to reach global short film filmmaker audience and acquire users.

Our team consists of folks of diverse experience and interests and we are keen to share our thoughts and learning along the way as we chart new grounds.
If you are interested, please write to: support@shortfundly.com with your brief self introduction, name and contact number. Share your linkedin profile.

Perks of working at Shortfundly

– Watching video/ short films/ viral content is part of the job

– Interacting with filmmakers/ artists/ models is part of the job

– Discussing film stories/ brainstorming on scripts/ creating videos is part of the job

Data Driven SEO Specialist at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

We are looking for a SEO specialist to join the Shortfundly crew!

You will have the opportunity to work across our web products including a video platform for audience and a content management system for creators. We looking to experiment on new engagement & retention techniques – so that will be something exciting & fun! Your work will touch the lives of millions, and spread awesome shortfilm from india to the world.

General Skills:

Administer search engine programs (XML sitemaps, webmaster tools) for purposes of diagnostic reporting

Working with research tools such as Woorank, Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz Analytics, Google Analytics and Webmaster tools

Develop relationships with bloggers, webmaster & build organic links

Develop and execute link building strategy; optimize links for search relevance and implement link building programs/tactics

Develop/execute SEO strategies to achieve and maintain top rankings on major search engines

Assist in development and execution of communication/content strategies via social communities in coordination with SEO goals

Keep pace with SEO, search engine, social media and internet marketing industry trends and developments

Forming processes for teamwork involving social, copywriting, and development resource

Experience – 0 to 2 years

Qualification – Doesn’t matter

Perks of working at Shortfundly

– Watching video/ short films/ viral content is part of the job
– Interacting with filmmakers/ artists/ models is part of the job
– Discussing film stories/ brainstorming on scripts/ creating videos is part of the job
Benefits & Culture
– Flexible hours
– Professional Development
– Small team where everyone is valued

If you are interested , forward your resume to info@shortfundly.com with a brief paragraph summarizing your skill set and experience along with a portfolio of the work you believe is relevant. Send Your Linkedin profile, It’s mandatory.

Skills
SEM, SEO, SEO/SEM, Search, Search Engine Optimization, SEO and Marketing Services, Search Engine Marketing (SEM), Digital Marketing, Digital Optimization Including SEO, SEO and Internet Markeitng, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Google AdSense, Analtyics, Google Adwords and Analytics, SEO and Website Analytics, Ahrefs, MOZ Tools, WooRank, SEMRush

PR / Syndication Manager at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

Shortfundly would be place for you, if you love the following in any particular order:
a. Movies
b. PR (press release activities) Brand building
c. Startup culture

Shortfundly.com is creating a digital revolution in Shortfilm Industry. The online shortfilm sharing portal (shortfundly) start collecting 22,000+ short films to different shortfilm categories from new age filmmakers. This portal will also use its contacts to promote the films in the shortfilm festival circuit. Shortfundly shares plenty of new films every day. We are planning for big expansions in the future into other languages. We are bootstrap company. So, you are not only part of team, you are part of the company.

The PR and content syndication role involves seeking and maintaining content partnerships with online publishers worldwide. You will also write press releases for our shortfundly, manage public relations with regional media and handle press engagements to promote our shortfundly further!

You will be working closely with the content team to curate and syndicate short films to external content and media partners.

You should have:

Passion for films and stories
Knowledge of online media and editorial trends
Good writing and communication skills
Creative and enthusiastic about learning
Prior experience in a PR role (preferably)
This role requires you to be based in Chennai

Experience – 0 to 2 years

Qualification – Doesn’t matter

Our team consists of folks of diverse experience and interests and we are keen to share our thoughts and learnings along the way as we chart new grounds. If you are interested, please write to: support@shortfundly.com with your brief self introduction, name and contact number. Share your linkedin profile.

Perks of working at Shortfundly

– Watching video/ short films/ viral content is part of the job

– Interacting with filmmakers/ artists/ models is part of the job

– Discussing film stories/ brainstorming on scripts/ creating videos is part of the job
