DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Company

Upingo facilitates one-to-one in-person networking opportunities for the London Startup community. The Founders have significant ambition for growth.

We are looking for an Undergraduate or recent Graduate who wants to join an early stage Startup with full responsibility for Marketing.

Who are we looking for?

We are seeking an enthusiastic, self-motivated team member to drive the growth of the platform. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to be awarded equity in the business (in the near term) and become a key part of the Founding Team.

Location

The candidate will work remotely, though it makes most sense to be based in London. Hours will be flexible, though the capacity to engage with the Founders within certain windows (to be agreed upon) will be important.

Role

-Architecting and executing the social media strategy for Upingo.

-Responsibility for planning and financial control of all digital marketing.

-Copywriting for customer email marketing, newsletters and social media.

-Review and analysis pay-per-click social media accounts.

-Architecting and executing digital and email marketing campaigns.

-Analysis of marketing effectiveness and carrying out A/B testing.

-General sector research and analysis.

Requirements

-Undergraduate or recent Graduate in a Marketing discipline (candidates with a different academic background should be able to demonstrate successful marketing projects or relevant independent study).

-Experience/strong understanding of current online marketing concepts, strategies and best practices. 

-Excellent communicator (fluent in English).

-Self-motivated and proactive.

Why work for Upingo?

This is a phenomenal opportunity for an Undergraduate or recent Graduate to put their learnings into practice in the real world. For the right candidate, an equity award (in the near term) is very possible and moreover, the opportunity to join an ambitious Startup, making a positive impact, at the earliest of stages.

Job Type: Part Time.

Salary: Unpaid, but good potential for equity award for the right candidate.

items.title: JavaScript developer for a new fintech product
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=4, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=41}
items.content:
JavaScript developer for a new fintech product

Company: Vox Financial Partners
Belfast, United Kingdom

[Note: we are open to remote work if you can spend at least a few days a month in our Belfast office.]

THE ROLE
You’ll be the person responsible for building the front-ends to Opal, a cloud platform to create and manage Structured Documents: documents represented as data, created and managed programatically.

You'll be using JavaScript, React, HTML, and CSS to make the user experience sing. We don’t want your typical ugly enterprise app: it has to be elegant, delightful to use, and enticing during a demo.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
You’ll be doing some or all of the following:

  • working with our product manager to refine the UI/UX requirements
  • coding the front-end for the web and Office apps
  • writing some basic test packs. We won’t go overboard but we aren’t flying by the seat of our pants, either
  • in partnership with the CTO, the technical lead, and the rest of your team, defining and implementing standards for how we work: our agile methodology, coding standards, development tools, deployment practices, and more. This is a green field development and we want to use tomorrow’s best practices today.

WHO WE WANT
We are looking for a smart person with initiative and good judgment, who works well with others, and who will always look to balance the urgent needs of clients with the long-term technical architecture for our product.

You need to have:

  • a minimum of three years’ experience using client-side web technologies with a solid knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3
  • experience with Node JS, and webpack, as well as a unit testing framework such as Jest
  • a desire to learn new things. For example, we have a Ruby on Rails back-end, so there is an opportunity to become a full stack developer (if you want to).

Any of these things will help you stand out:

  • an eye for good design. You won’t be getting detailed wireframes, so your role will be at least partly that of a designer
  • experience with ReactJS, or a similar front-end library or framework
  • experience with Bootstrap or similar – we’ll be using Office Fabric, a similar library from Microsoft
  • working with RESTful API back-end components.

WHAT WE OFFER

As well as the basics - competitive pay and benefits – we offer work on a greenfield product, in a small startup-like team. We’ll invest so you have good tools to work with and we’ll keep your skills fresh with a budget for technical books, training, and the like.

Apply now

items.title: PPC Advertising Content Writer
items.content:
Who We Are

The Urban Cowgirl provides competitive advertising strategies to the top 1% of Amazon Sellers. We create story-driven instructional courses to educate and empower Amazon Sellers to create successful Amazon Advertising campaigns. We are also a service business, partnering with our clients to scale their businesses and achieve their desired outcomes. We immerse ourselves in advanced advertising strategy.

Who You Are

You’re confident in your ability to write instructional advertising content with a strong voice and style. You’re a structured thinker and have experience writing step-by-step, detailed explanations of technical processes. In this position, you’ll be responsible for creating study guides, presentation slides, video scripts, and website content.

You have PPC Advertising experience and an understanding of advanced search marketing strategies. You’re interested in teaching others through engaging written content. You have the ability to work effectively as part of a team, take direction, and deliver assets on deadline in a fast-paced environment.

 

Responsibilities

  • Create digital written content that is bold, strategic, and on-brand
  • Translate complex ideas into effective written content
  • Research, author, and publish outstanding content under tight deadlines
  • Create and manage content for social media channels
  • Collaborate with the creative team remotely via Slack and email

 

Requirements:

  • 2+ years experience writing and publishing digital advertising content
  • Strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills
  • Technical and instructional writing skills
  • Advanced understanding of PPC Advertising
  • Advanced understanding of creating and optimizing PPC advertising campaigns
  • Experience creating multiple drafts and refining your work to achieve excellence
  • Working knowledge of Adobe InDesign, or strong ability to learn software basics
  • Experience collaborating with creative teams of 3 or more people
  • Strong time management and organization skills
  • Critical thinking skills to generate original and innovative ideas
  • Skilled at identifying challenges and proactively creating solutions
  • Digital storytelling and content creation experience a plus

 

Essential Software Experience:

  • Adobe InDesign (1+ years)
  • Google Drive (1+ years)
  • Microsoft Word (5+ years)
  • Powerpoint (5+ years)
  • Keynote (5+ years)

 

The Urban Cowgirl values loyalty and hard work. We’re committed to creating great work experiences for our team with opportunities for advancement.

items.title: Digital Marketing Manager
items.content:
Introduction

This is an opportunity to fill a much needed role that hasn’t yet existed at Apolitical and have significant impact on the team.

In this role, you will be a powerful amplifier for Apolitical’s work, leveraging resources across the company to get the word out about us and drive a key success metric for the company: network membership growth. You will be responsible for two levers that drive membership growth:

1) Optimising our presence in google searches – the way that most potential users find us and join.

2) PR and marketing around specific growth campaigns and pieces of content produced by the team to maximise their impact for user growth and sales.

You will manage a team on link building and work widely across the company to bring together activity relating to membership growth – and translate it into an effective digital strategy for Apolitical across online search, social media, email communications, and our distribution partners.

You will be analytical and driven by measuring and responding to success metrics of the campaigns and outreach activities you conduct, so that we continuously focus on the most impactful growth channels as a company.



Key responsibilities:

SEO:
Hit monthly targets for improvements in Apolitical’s search performance as a critical lever of membership growth, a critical company priority.
Manage a team of interns as an effective sales function to execute Apolitical’s SEO strategy.
Work with the rest of the Apolitical team to make our existing work optimal for search.

Digital content PR opportunities:
Develop and execute a strategy to leverage the company’s content, community, and growth initiatives to maximise publicity amongst relevant potential users and partners.
Develop and maintain partnerships with the whole range of press, networks, and organisations that are effective distribution partners for Apolitical’s content.

Digital growth ringleader:
Work across and coordinate initiatives across relevant teams to maximise the impact of any activity in the company for our membership growth and engagement.



Key attributes:

Must haves:
Autonomous and self sufficient – some prior management experience
Organised and efficient
Data drive and analytical – with a desire to experiment, measure and assess the effectiveness of communication strategies, and an appreciation for success indices
A desire to expand and develop a career in digital marketing and growth
Creativity, enthusiasm and a passion for Apolitical’s mission
Proven experience of using digital channels to build profile, from more traditional routes of selective content placement through to running online campaigns and using distribution partners
An excellent written and verbal communicator
Able to work effectively through other teams and get buy into your strategy
A hustler and do-er – being willing to roll up your sleeves to execute on your strategies


Strongly preferred:
Prior SEO experience and knowledge and communications
Experience of working in the policy space (govt, think tanks, NGOs, foundations etc)


Salary: Between £30- 40k depending on experience

Application: Please note that all applicants must have a right to work in the UK.

items.title: Clevertech: Sr. Route Optimization Engineer
items.content:
Sr. Route Optimization Engineer

Company: Clevertech
Headquarters: Remote
https://www.clevertech.biz/

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces.

REQUIREMENTS

  • You love doing puzzles
  • You have serious math skills
  • You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
  • You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
  • You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings

BENEFITS

Own Your Time
We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travelers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

Recharge Time
We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself
You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

Focused Work
You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

Learn at your edges
We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here. And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag
And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over Slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.
Clevertech Culture Video

Apply for this position

https://hire.clevertech.biz/job/5b2be18e62c05c001b2000b0

items.title: Digital Science Writer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Digital Science Writer

Writing
California or Washington States
Company: Bulletproof
Full Time

Overview

Bulletproof is an omni-channel content driven consumer products company. Our vision is to make high performance a daily reality for everyone by upgrading the earth’s coffee and food. Our mission is to help people perform better, think faster, and live better using a proven blend of ancient knowledge and new technologies, informed by science, and measured results from our customers. BP products help people live better by using fat for fuel, saying goodbye to sugar and supercharging mitochondria.

Bulletproof has a team of experienced entrepreneurs and biohackers working to make high performance a daily reality for everyone on the planet. While our culture is casual and our workplace flexible, everyone on the team is passionate, smart, focused and driven.

Our customers know that our coffee, beverages, food, and supplements are the purest you can get anywhere, and you can expect to feel a difference in how you perform the first time you experience them. Environmentally conscious and ethically sourced products build a sustainable foundation for future generations to thrive

Bulletproof is seeking a dynamic and talented digital journalist with a strong background in science-based health and wellness reporting to join the blog’s content team.

The ideal candidate geeks out over the latest scientific research, has a deep knowledge of the wellness space, and experience working at an online news or lifestyle site. Candidates must live in Washington State or California.

As the digital writer, you will write engaging stories across all verticals and mediums. That includes video scripts, social media captions, viral news commentary, listicles, and deeply researched and footnoted long-form features.  You know all the buzzwords (lectins, nootropics, mitochondria) and what they mean — and can point to a more than a few studies on each one. You also know the nutrition space intimately and can explain to anyone the difference between Paleo, Whole30, keto and Bulletproof.  You possess impeccable grammar, organization, clarity and accuracy, and are obsessive about formatting, style, and voice. You are inquisitive, full of great story ideas, and know how to write an irresistible headline. You’ve also never missed a deadline.  Bonus points for basic HTML, SEO, and on-camera experience.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Write rigorously researched, science-backed articles, meeting daily deadlines quickly and accurately.
  • Turn complicated scientific jargon into snappy and engaging video scripts.
  • Pitchclickable, science-backed content (infographics, videos, articles) according to search trends and what’s resonating in the wellness and biohacking spaces.
  • Be a scientific advisor to the editorial and social teams, providing easy-to-understand answers to our readers’ questions about the Bulletproof lifestyle, with links to studies that back up the advice.
  • Work with the social, photo, and video teams to help shape storytelling efforts.
  • Build content in WordPress, optimizing articles and images for search.

    • About You:
    • You live in WA or CA, or are willing to move there.
    • You nerd out on research. You read PubMed for fun. You know what good research looks like, and you seek it out.
    • You have demonstrated experience as a video journalist – writing scripts for YouTube and social media.
    • Your writing is scientific but accessible. Think … explaining the Krebs cycle to a 5th grader. Or describing mitochondria to a friend with zero science background.
    • You take the reins and run with them, requiring little oversight to get things done.
    • You love learning — and you really love grammar.
    • You’re curious about the Bulletproof Diet and lifestyle, and might even be willing to try it out to better understand your reader.

      • Skills and Experience:
      • Science writing/editing background is mandatory.
      • 3-5 years of professional editorial experience in a dynamic, deadline- and results-oriented environment, with the clips to prove it.
      • You have a portfolio of videos that demonstrate your script-writing ability.
      • The writing style chops to shift gears — one day you’re working on a deep-dive biohacking piece, the next day you’re writing a Whole30 recipe roundup.
      • Highly proficient in WordPress, MS Office Suite, project management, and editorial calendar software.
      • Some sense of visual design is a plus — you think about how to engage the reader with images and infographics as well as good writing.
      • Bachelor’s degree preferred in a related field such as journalism, nutrition, biology, psychology, neuroscience, medicine, or similar.
      • On-camera experience is a plus, but not mandatory

        • To apply:
        • Send us your resume and cover letter, telling us why you’d make the perfect fit.
        • Include the following 2-3 writing samples:
          • One showcasing your deep-dive research skills. Show off your chops at making a complex subject easily understood and fun. This article should have plenty of scientific references.

            • This is a full-time, work-from-home position working with a team of seasoned, creative journalists and thought leaders. At Bulletproof, we value balance, fun, and continually learning in work and play. Being Bulletproof is being intellectually curious and making the most of opportunities to grow personally and professionally. You are knowledgeable, reliable, innovative, and open.

            Think you’ve got what it takes?

            Let’s talk!

            To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://jobs.jobvite.com/bulletproof/job/o7027fw0 →

items.content:
Long Term Blogger for SEO/Linkbuilding SaaS Blog

Company: Monitor Backlinks
Location: Remote

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Monitor Backlinks is exactly what it sounds like—a tool to monitor your site's backlinks (+ competitor backlinks) along with other important SEO metrics: https://monitorbacklinks.com

We're hiring expert writers to share in-depth knowledge of SEO, backlinks and linkbuilding strategies on our blog: blog.monitorbacklinks.com.

This is not a ghostwriting position. You'll get full credit for your work, including a short bio (with a personal link) at the end of your post.

Payment is done via PayPal on the 14th each month (we will pay for the fees).

We're looking for writers who can:

  • dig deep into SEO/link-building topics and provide tons of valuable information and insights — beyond the basics, no fluff
  • capture the "friendly expert" voice and bring personality and humor to dry topics
  • write 2-4 blog posts per month
  • work in WordPress and our content marketing platform (CoSpot)

If you’re interested and you do an outstanding job, this can even develop into a part-time or full-time writing or editing position.

To Apply

If you’re interested, please send an email to editors [ at ] monitorbacklinks [ dot ] com and:

  • describe your experience with SEO/link-building
  • send 2-3 relevant writing samples (URLs of published blog posts preferred)
  • mention 2-3 headlines of blog posts you think might work on our blog.
  • tell us your competitive rate per 1200-word blog post
  • tell us if you're interested in editing work! (we're actively looking for a good editor to join us part time or full time)

Application Instructions

Send us an email per the application instructions above.

Digital Marketing Assistant

You want to travel while earning money with a long term job?
We are looking for a remote Marketing Assistent. We expect the skills in the list below:
You are a communicative and flexible person and can talk and write in perfect or very good German and English.
You know to use InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop to do smaller projects (such as Print Ads for Newspapers or Ads for Facebook, improve some photos, do some picture compositions with photoshop, produce some mockups for presentations, do little adaptions in existing brochures with InDesign, correct some Logos with Illustrator and so on) by yourself until the expected deadline.
You are willing and able to switch between projects and learn quick about the project structure and support the team with all the little but important tasks which are to do to provide good customer service as an advertising agency.
You want to work in a remote team.
You have a structured and cooperative working style and you are thrilled to overcome some obstacles and able to deal with challenging tasks by yourself using your creative mindset - and google to research how to do the task. (I do not mean copy and paste:))

We are a cool team from experienced marketing experts, we offer very interesting tasks with a lot of different, complex projects.
You have the great chance to grow your skills. We have fascinating tasks. Regular income with the same company. High flexibility and a long term business relationship. Work in a global remote team.

Digital Analytics Consultant / Google Analytics at InfoTrust

Cincinnati, United States, Remote · Full Time
InfoTrust is a Marketing Technology company that helps some of the largest brands in the world build measurement architectures to track what their visitors do online. Why is this important? As they say, “data is the new oil” and digital analytics is one of the critical sources of data that allows organizations to make better decisions about advertising, merchandising, user experience, etc.Read More

InfoTrust is a Marketing Technology company that helps some of the largest brands in the world build measurement architectures to track what their visitors do online. Why is this important? As they say, “data is the new oil” and digital analytics is one of the critical sources of data that allows organizations to make better decisions about advertising, merchandising, user experience, etc.

With two offices (Cincinnati and Dubai), InfoTrust is rapidly growing through its work with some of the largest multinational brands in the world as well as Internet Retailer 1000 companies in North America. Google has recognized InfoTrust with the following certifications – Google Analytics Certified Partner, Google Analytics Premium Reseller and Google Tag Manager Specialist.

InfoTrust is now a four time finalist in Greater Cincinnati’s Best Places to Work (2012, 2013, 2014, 2015). We are also recognized by Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest growing companies in the country.

InfoTrust just moved into an amazing new office with lots of sun and open space, sit/stand desks, ping-pong, and daily catered lunch. Our team of web analytics experts have been continuously recognized among the world analytics elite.

We are currently looking for a technologist who is interested in becoming an expert in analytics and digital marketing. If you’re a person who loves technical challenges, learning how things work, looking over code, debugging javascript, and building scalable systems for some of largest websites in the world this will be an ideal role for you. Not only do we work with cutting edge technology, but we work beyond the cutting edge, with access to technologies that are not available to the general public. We are looking for people for whom being first in the world to play with new technology, even before public beta, and potentially coming up with architectures for huge household brands is exciting. If you are one of those people – contact us.

Applied
Apply to InfoTrust
Add a message to InfoTrust
Apply

Job Description

Rocketship -- that is the word that was used to explain what it is like to join InfoTrust at this time. We have done all the prep, we have build this amazing architecture for success (the ship) not we are getting ready to launch? Are you ready to board?

We are currently looking for a DIGITAL ANALYTICS CONSULTANT who is an expert in analytics and digital marketing.

The Digital Analytics Consultant role will be responsible for client management, advanced implementations of Google Analytics, auditing and troubleshooting existing configurations, and reporting analysis to improve clients’ digital marketing initiatives.

You will work closely with web analytics engineer/architect to develop custom tagging and measurement systems.

Responsibilities:

- Identifying client objectives and mapping suitable analytics solutions, ensuring that all required performance data can be reliably tracked and reported
- Advanced Google Tag Manager architecture and setup of complex tracking scripts
- Producing analytics audit reports for corrective or advanced Google Analytics tracking and data collection architecture
- Performing ad-hoc analytics consultancies for clients and documenting the work
– Delivering analytics audit reports to clients and presenting findings in person or via conference calls
- Representing the InfoTrust team in client meetings and presentations, providing technical analytics input
- Assisting in educating clients on the importance of online measurement & providing best practice guidance for technical aspects of analytics
- Providing training to clients ranging from product training for marketing teams to implementation training for technical teams
- Providing consultancy on campaign tagging and providing consultancy on campaign tagging and additional on-site tracking
- Providing guidance to data analysts to produce marketing dashboards via Google Drive, Excel and various APIs

Requirements

We are looking for someone the possess our core values and is looking for a place to drive impact, provide superior client support with GA and is looking for learn and grow as an individual and share that knowledge to drive the company towards continued success. The Senior Consultant would be expected to have the following background to be successful:

- Experience working with clients in a consulting role
- Well versed in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager -- from developing client specific implementation plans, to overseeing the implementation and assisting them to identify key ways to improve their marketing initiatives based on the good clean data that InfoTrust will provide.
- Proven experience as a team player -- You enjoy working in a fun and collaborative culture and are willing to take initiative!

We are looking for someone in Cincinnati, Ohio. Ask why Cincinnati might be a great option to relocate to -- we are happy to brag about our city!

We would be willing to consider remote (experienced) workers, just let us know why you are great at working remotely.

Must be authorized to work for any US employer.

Skills
Javascript, Web Analytics, Consulting, Client Management, Google Analytics, • Google Analytics and Google Webmaster Tools, Google Tag Manager, Client Education, Google data studio
Compensation
$72K–$86K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Available

Dubai, Remote · Internship
Our mission is to make the world a better place through education.Read More

Our mission is to make the world a better place through education.

How?

Our vision is to improve accessibility through modern technology.

Your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to help us create the next big thing. Help us shake up the scene using your strengths and bring new ideas to the table.

We are a dynamic young startup based out of Dubai, looking to grow the family. Be a part of this exciting phase and grow something that is growing fast.

About the team: We are result driven, value being practical, our work environment is flexible, and we are all very ambitious. Are you someone who wants to create something amazing, be empowered and are hands on?

Who we are? At Teach Me Now, we are an international mix that have passions for things like rollerblading, argentine tango, intellectual debates and indulging in amazing food at the office.

We are looking for people who dare to be different and want to be a part of something that help change the way the world learns.

Applied
Apply to Teach Me Now And EdTechSolutions.org
Add a message to Teach Me Now And EdTechSolutions.org
Apply

Job Description

To celebrate new ideas and foster innovation we are launching the Young Talent Program. Our mission is to make the world a better place through education.

How? To improve accessibility through modern technology.

Your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to help us create the next big thing in education and shake up the scene using your strengths and bring new ideas to the table.  

Our rigorous program provides you with the opportunity of taking the lead and develop skills in the following:

Month 1: Market and Business Development

You will conduct market research; strategies international marketing plans, use in-depth analytical tools and structure your processes.

Month 2: Digital Marketing

This month will focus on social media marketing and lead generation. This is understanding more than just likes and virality but also engagement, content creation, media planning, strategy and SEO optimisation. Creating a strategy and testing what works. Learn fast, fail fast.

Month 3:  Product Development

In Tech, product development, testing and iteration is key. Be a part of the process and help bring the product to life. You will be a part of testing, feedback data analysis, and more.

Opportunity for a Full-time Position:

Upon the completion of the program, successful candidates are up for the possibility of full time hire and being part of the core team and can focus on one of the three categories.

Requirements:
1. University Degree (Completed or Currently Pursuing)
2. Fluent in English (Additional Language is a plus)
3. International experiences or exposure
4. Passion for education and technology

Technical Competencies:

1. Eagerness to make a difference and stimulate change
2. Courage to challenge the status quo and persistence to succeed and achieve challenging tasks.
3. Analytical and love data!

Communication:

The ability to plan and deliver communication in a persuasive and tactful way. You must be fluent in English.

To Apply:

Send your CV and cover letter to hr@teachmenow.com. You need to tell us why you want to work with us.

Early applications are preferred. Full time job offer will be considered after the internship is complete.

Skills
User Experience Design, Social Media Marketing, Market Research, Sales and Marketing, Software

We aim to make knowledge accessible through modern technology. To achieve our goal, we are doing two things.

Creating educational software and at the same time hosting a global marketplace for one to one learning - where anyone can teach and everyone can learn.

Teach Me Now is our public facing website and marketplace, where we have teachers/ tutors and students learning around the world. The goal is:

Through EdTechSolutions.org and in our second phase is licensing this software to schools and educational systems, to become more than just an LMS or storage provider. We help them become an online school and sell their expertise online.

Future phases have many exciting plans. Be a part of something exciting and new, and that will have an impact on generations to come.

items.content:
One in five households in the UK live in social housing, a sector with the right values at its core but that has historically struggled to deploy innovations in the home. Many residents still can’t afford to heat their homes and live in cold, mouldy properties they can’t be proud of. At Switchee, we believe that everyone deserves to live in a decent home and that the environments we inhabit have a massive influence on our ability to enjoy life and prosper.

We may be only three years old, but it’s already been quite a ride! Our first product, the internet connected Switchee thermostat is already in 35 of the biggest housing providers in the UK. We’re growing 100% year on year and are backed by some of the best-known investors in technology and social impact.

To strengthen our small team of 15 passionate and ambitious people we are looking for an outstanding individual to join us as

*Marketing* *Manager*.

We are driven by a collective desire to make a positive impact in the housing sector, both for residents and landlords, so your commitment to our values and mission are paramount.

*Your* *responsibilities*

As Marketing Manager you will play an important role by supporting all of Switchee’s marketing efforts, owning a number channels and producing content strategies and collateral. On joining you will be exposed to all commercial and operational aspects of the business. Depending on requirements and the specific development plan we agree with you, you will gain experience in ops and customer account management / support teams so that you have a full understanding of Switchee before taking up your role in marketing.

Being more specific, you will:

* Work closely with our CEO, CCO, Head of Sales as well as Head of Marketing
* Contribute to the development of Switchee’s marketing strategy
* Generate insightful, thought provoking written content
* Brief partners to deliver engaging visual & press content
* Manage online and social media marketing & advertising campaigns
* Manage social media (Twitter & LinkedIn)
* Organise attendance at conferences – negotiating exhibitor plots and speaking slots
* Work with the sales team to produce relevant sales and marketing collateral
* Work with operations and resident support to design and produce resident communications
* Prepare quarterly and annual reports


We are a company built on a strong technical foundation. You’ll need to grasp and communicate a technical solution with clients. We also expect you to work closely with Product Development to ensure our product evolves with the customer’s needs at the very centre.



*Your* *experience*

We firmly believe extraordinary people can come from a wide range of places – but we wouldn’t be surprised if the person who gets this role has:

* At least 2 years’ experience in marketing
* Bachelor’s degree from a top university
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proven ability to develop and implement effective marketing strategies
* Strong analytical & numeracy skills with command of Excel
* B2B experience preferred

Nice to have:

* Experience in a small & quickly expanding business preferred
* Knowledge of the housing sector preferred
* Experience working with Internet of Things devices

*You*

We are a diverse bunch of people at Switchee. That said, there are some characteristics we always look for:

* You deeply care about Switchee’s mission; you have a desire to build something revolutionary, that will disrupt an industry, and positively impact ordinary people’s lives.
* You care about the environment, are interested in energy efficiency and have thought about the challenges and opportunities posed by an evolving domestic energy market
* You like technology and neat solutions to complex problems
* You thrive on challenge and change; you naturally gravitate to the hardest questions first and love thinking differently to solve them.
* You are biased towards action and you’re happiest when you’re ‘getting stuff done’.
* You’re open, positive & straightforward. You’re not afraid to stand up for your convictions, even when it’s hard to do so.
* You delight in your colleagues’ successes and thrive on your failures; you grasp any opportunity for learning and constantly seek to improve.


*Our* *mission*

We believe that radical innovation in internet connected technology can ensure that every resident, every day, is living in a home that allows them to succeed. That’s why our products are built not just on great technology, but on an understanding of what people want from the space they live in.

This approach led us to reimagine the most mundane household object, a thermostat, into a product that automagically reduces energy bills, looks great and offers control to those who want it.

We are also revolutionising the way social landlords manage their housing stock with an obsessively tailored SAAS property dashboard and handy alerts on things like when the boiler is going to break.

Our next project is to build the ultimate connected hub for the social home. It’s going to revolutionise the way residents interact with their properties and landlords manage their homes.



*Life* *at* *Switchee*

We like to keep things simple and flexible at Switchee and consider you to be joining our family. We don’t currently track holidays so you’re free to take as much as you need. We occasionally work remotely but are sensitive to the needs of our colleagues.

We socialise together with regular outings in London and an annual “working remotely” trip where you have the option (but not obligation) to join us in working from a fun location.

If we end up working together, we can offer a competitive salary and a generous stake in the company.

If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now! Please be in touch soon as we’ll proceed once the right person is found. If you’d like to apply please submit a CV and cover letter on our Careers page.

items.title: Epic Analytics Developer I - Cheyenne Regional Medical Center - Cheyenne, WY
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Epic Analytics Developer I

Company: Cheyenne Regional Medical Center
Location: Cheyenne, WY 82001
ROLE SUMMARY

The Epic Analytics Developer I is proficient in the organization’s clinical and/or revenue workflows and is organization’s expert report writing. This individual acts as the liaison between operations and data; is responsible for the quality and accuracy of reports produced by the Epic Reporting team.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Design business intelligence reporting platform utilizing Epic data.

2. Provides report specific advice for design and solutions for reporting needs.

3. Advises customers and recommends reporting options using reporting expertise.

4. Escalates potential system and work effort risks; contributes to status updates.

5. Sets priorities for reporting requests and works with the requesting customers to understand the prioritization.

6. Uses the full portfolio of Epic and non-Epic reporting tools available.

7. Responsible for maintaining existing reports and analyzes/evaluates requirements for changes, system upgrades, etc. while preserving data integrity and quality control of reports.

8. Reviews upgrade documentation related to Clarity features and released Crystal reporting content and determines how to implement the changes.

9. Assists end-users in the interpretation and integration of reports.

10. Construct testing scripts to validate system parameters and functionality performs as specified with application teams for accuracy of reports.

11. Assists with onboarding new employees as needed.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified and employees may be required to perform other duties as assigned.

SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, EXPECTATIONS, AND ABILITIES

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong Analytical and problem solving skills
  • Ability to work both independently and in teams
  • Ability to independently prioritize work assignments, meet deadlines and manage multiple projects and/or priorities
  • Proficient with SQL and relational database concepts, including primary keys, foreign keys, and joins
  • Ability to use report writing tools such as Business Objects
  • Proficient in developing a test plan and executing test scenarios for system readiness
  • Able to cross train to other areas if necessary
  • Skilled with data warehouses, data stores, and data marts
  • Comfortable facilitating communication amongst technical and non-technical project staff and stakeholders
  • Expert in translating user requirements into functional and design specifications
  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment, problem solve and develop solutions
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, email, intranet, internet, and other IT systems.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Two years of experience in Information Technologies
  • One year of healthcare experience
  • Epic certification in at least one application and/or able to achieve Epic certification within 90 days of last class
  • Able to maintain Continue Epic Education requirements for certification
  • Able to travel for training or work with remote clients
  • Available outside of normal business hours
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s Degree in relevant area
  • Two years of experience in design, architecting, implementation and support of relational databases including use of SQL query techniques to access relational databases
  • One year of project based experience

items.content:
*About Voltaware*

Voltaware is a dynamic London-based start-up at the forefront of energy monitoring and electricity usage itemisation.

We’re developing machine learning algorithms and building UX optimised interfaces to deliver real data insights to business and domestic users.


*The Team*

You’ll be joining an international team of entrepreneurs, engineers and designers with a history of successful application development and an enthusiasm for innovation and developing cutting edge applications.

Product Owner for Electricity Data Intelligence Startup


*We are looking for* an experienced and enthusiastic product owner to ensure the success of our product line-up. You will be in charge of understanding user and client needs and translate them into business cases.
We also expect you to liaise with our Data Science team and understand what is possible and how to embed knowledge into our products. Data Science is a rapidly evolving and exciting field with huge potential. We want you to be a part of it and help us realise its full potential with break-through products never seen before!
Join us for a journey instead of a job!


*Responsibilities*

* Maximise the value of the product, contributing to efficient deliveries and satisfied customers
* Liaise with clients to understand their use cases and translate them into product strategy
* Ongoing management of functional specifications and change requests throughout the entire life-cycle of development projects
* Produce high quality use cases and requirement documents
* Work hand in hand with the development team, following the agile sprints as product owner
* Manage development backlog according to the product strategy
* Maintain and communicate the product road map to the management team
* Interact regularly with the sales and distribution teams to gather feedback from the field
* Regularly participate in client meetings and field implementations


*Requirements*

* Enthusiastic about technology and innovation
* Strong oral and written communication skills are essential!
* Ability to work in a distributed and highly multicultural team


*Preferred Experience*

*Have worked on a project involving machine learning and data science
*Previous product owner roles preferable
*Experience working with start-ups
*Have worked with international and remote teams
*French or Italian languages is a plus



In addition to your CV, please submit the answer to the following question:

What excites you about working in a start-up?

At Lucid, we are bringing depth information to mobile phones with zero hardware costs. We have an easy-integratable Android SDK dynamic and customizable for any dual camera independent of baseline, field of view or resolution as long as there is overlapping performance. We have developed pure software depth technology based on AI leveraging concepts of how the brain processes and learns to perceive the environment. We have years of depth data stored on our secure cloud for continuous improvements of depth vision through Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.Read More

At Lucid, we are bringing depth information to mobile phones with zero hardware costs. We have an easy-integratable Android SDK dynamic and customizable for any dual camera independent of baseline, field of view or resolution as long as there is overlapping performance. We have developed pure software depth technology based on AI leveraging concepts of how the brain processes and learns to perceive the environment. Are you passionate about virtual reality (VR) and or cameras? Want to connect to the Silicon Valley startup scene? Come join us!

We are looking for interns who have passion for startups and want to work and learn from a fast-paced and fast changing environment. We need someone who can look how to attract users, and retain them in new and innovative ways. Creativity & scrappiness encouraged if not required.

We have a strong team that is collaborative and really excited about VR and cameras. There has been a lot of interest in our product from VCs, developers, and even the average Joe.

This is an unpaid internship at first, if we think you are a good fit we can start that discussion. We are excited for you to join us on this adventure!

You will be responsible for shaping strategic goals and partnership and leading marketing campaigns to achieve our goals. You’ll work with people that are passionate about education and childcare, eldercare, families, and those that want to make the world a better place!

WHO YOU ARE
You love helping people feel empowered through education, and are passionate about childcare, elder care, and caregiving. You have a track record of building go-to-market strategy from scratch, establishing a brand voice that resonates with parents and caregivers, and analyzing data to drive great online campaigns. You have built successful marketing strategies around education-based services with at least 2 other companies.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Work closely with the CEO to build innovative marketing strategies to engage our target audiences: nannies, caregivers agencies, and parents
Find lucrative distribution channels online for classes and online educational services
Find opportunities expand and grow Care Academy services and networks
Using your hard skills (photoshop, design, analytics,etc.) and the soft ones to build a distribution engine for our team
s

Networking and building community is second nature to you, and you have the social media presence and personal relationships to prove it. Experienced Startup Team Player/Founder who can drive forward or pivot to capitalize on opportunities and partnerships
Looking to build a growing idea that can have amazing impact in the world

items.title: Marketing Manager
items.content:
Marketing Manager


CCS Group

This is a fantastic opportunity to join our company at an exciting time as we enter a new phase of growth and launch new products. We are looking for an ambitious, motivated and energetic marketing professional to help take the company to the next level.

## About the company
CCS Group was established in 2007. We provide low-cost card payment processing services to small business customers in the UK.

We are a small, experienced and customer-driven team. Our mission is to help small businesses flourish.

The company has recently completed a major overhaul of its product offering. We are now focused on achieving growth by expanding our customer base.

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for all marketing activities, across our two payment provider subsidiaries (CabCard Services and Optimus Pay).You will work directly with the Managing Director and the CTO to develop and implement a complete marketing strategy. This will include working on inbound (including SEO), paid, social, influencer, email and traditional media marketing activities. Your overall goal will be to grow the company's customer base and establish a functioning engine of growth. As a key part of a small team, your input will be valued and you will have a significant impact on the company's development. You will benefit from considerable autonomy, a flat management structure and a quick, collaborative decision-making process.Over time you will be able to grow your team in order to scale up marketing activities.The position offers a competitive salary with excellent rewards for the right candidate.

Requirements

You are a motivated, ambitious and energetic marketing expert. You are open, curious and innovative, with a bias to action, and you are an excellent written and verbal communicator.You have spent a number of years gaining marketing experience and are now looking to step up to a more challenging key marketing role with greater responsibility.You are able to easily shift from big-picture strategy to hands-on execution. You are able to independently prioritise, plan and execute your work.You stay up-to-date with new marketing trends and tools, and can select and apply them effectively.You can maximise the effectiveness of a modest budget and understand how to run low-cost channel experiments to test the effectiveness of a medium or message, before committing to a full campaign.You are confident wearing many hats, and have experience with (and a proven track record in) all or most of:- Marketing planning- Content strategy development- Storytelling- SEO- Media buying and PR- Branding and design- Asset creation including basic image and video editing- Social media management- Email marketing- PPC advertising- Conversion optimization- Analytics and metricsExperience marketing products to SME niches, ideally in the UK, is highly beneficial. Experience with payment-related products or financial services is beneficial but not essential.Please note this is a full-time (35-40 hours per week) remote role. You must be capable of, and comfortable with, working remotely and be familiar with a remote toolkit including Slack and Trello.Ideally you will normally be based within a European time zone (UTC ± 3), and you will have prior experience working remotely.

See more jobs at CCS Group

Visit CCS Group's website

items.content:
Marketing Engineering


Trivago N.V


As a Frontend Engineer in our Marketing Solutions team, you will actively shape the technical future of our high-quality marketing tools. In this role, you will work with top-notch technologies in a dynamic environment, enjoying the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new designs and effects.


If you are constantly seeking new challenges, and want to work within a creative, cutting edge setting, then read on, and join the Talent Community today!



What you'll do:




* Create user interfaces for our high-quality marketing applications.

* As a mediator between our designers and other developers, your knowledge and expertise in these two domains will be required.

* With the implementation of modern designs, you make sure that our front end is always a step ahead.

* Using pre-processors, you will code efficient, maintainable, scalable and cross-browser compatible CSS.

* Support the design and development process through creation and improvement of style guides and pattern libraries.

* Ensure trivago maintains its trendsetter status by familiarizing yourself with new technologies and keeping an eye out for upcoming trends and their applicability to our site.






What you'll definitely need:




* To have studied a core module in IT, or alternatively have successfully completed a comparable apprenticeship.

* Excellent CSS3/HTML5 knowledge, refined by extensive experience dealing with template engines.

* To take pride in your ability to build responsive sites and bullet proof CSS.

* Deep knowledge of JavaScript.

* To be no stranger to progressive enhancement.

* Extensive experience in the implementation of complex designs, ideally in a high-traffic environment.

* To love technical challenges and to strive for continuous development.

* To speak English (our company language) fluently.

* Knowledge of Angular and React will be appreciated.





Life at trivago is:




* The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

* Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

* Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

* The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

* The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free workshops, seminars, sports and activities.

* The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.

* Working from our picturesque Palma office overlooking the port

* To find out more about life at trivago follow us on Facebook - @lifeattrivago.





Additional information:




* trivago N.V. is an equal opportunity employer. Applications from individuals with disabilities are welcome.






See more jobs at Trivago N.V

items.title: Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
*Role Summary*

We’re looking for an ambitious and self-disciplined Marketing Manager to join our fast growing team. This is a true full-stack marketing role. You will be working alongside our Content & Design Lead as part of a two-person marketing team. Reporting directly to the CEO, this role presents an amazing opportunity to grow and manage our marketing function.

Our primary route to market is through accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will be responsible for maximising lead generation for our sales team. You will also be responsible for working with partner accounting and bookkeeping firms to market their Chaser offering to their clients; ensuring they make the most out of the block licences we sell to them.

We are growing at a fantastic rate. This is an incredible opportunity for someone talented and ambitious to make a huge impact. Our head office is located in Moorgate London. Half our team work remotely and we do offer remote working anywhere in the UK for the right candidate. Your responsibilities will include:

* *Understanding* | Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will need to * develop a deep empathy that can enable us to market effectively to them
* *Partner marketing* | Working with accounting and bookkeeping partners to help them effectively communicate the benefits of Chaser to their clients. For example, helping them design email campaigns and advising them on how best to run events. Identifying collateral and resources we need to provide them and working with our Content & Design Lead to produce it
* *Events* | Leading our events strategy and organisation of our exhibiting at them
* *Webinars* | Creating and running webinars as part of accounting and bookkeeping firms’ buying processes
* *Channel development* | Identifying opportunities for us to generate new leads for our sales team and running experiments to prove them out as marketing channels
* *External listings* | Managing and enacting our third party sites strategy (e.g. accounting software marketplaces and other software recommendation platforms) and managing our listings on those platforms
* *Website* | Overseeing the company’s website and its efficacy in converting visitors to sign ups and working with our Content & Design Lead to improve it
* *Analytics* | Preparing, managing and reporting on our marketing funnel analytics. We currently use Google Analytics, Mixpanel and GoSquared. You will take the lead on identifying the optimal mix of tools we should be using
* *PPC* | Managing and enacting our PPC strategy and working with our Content & Design Lead to deliver effective ad campaigns
* *SEO* | Managing and enacting our SEO strategy and working with our Content & Design Lead to optimise our website content for SEO purposes
* *Awards & PR* | Managing and enacting our Awards and PR strategy. Co-ordinating the relevant applications and external consultants

*About You*

There are a number of attributes that will be critical to success in this specific role. You will:

* have very strong empathy. The ability to build a deep and effective understanding of accountants and bookkeepers will be critical to success in this role
* be positive with an ability to engender the necessary energy and excitement in partners and customers to market Chaser effectively to their clients
* have a strong analytical capacity to be able to step back and interpret what the data (both qualitative as well as quantitative) is telling us
* have very strong time management and prioritisation skills. There will be a huge number of balls to juggle in this role
* have strong commercial and business acumen with an instinct for opportunity

There are also a number of attributes that will be critical to your success more generally at Chaser as a fast growing startup. You will:

* be a proactive self-starter who is comfortable taking the initiative and solving problems autonomously
be extremely ambitious
* love learning (fast!). You will be comfortable (well, as comfortable as it’s possible to be!) learning through trial and error. And when those errors happen, as they inevitably will, be able to lean in to learn from them fully
* not need to be an amateur netless tightrope walker, but you will be comfortable with the need to take risks in the role
* have excellent written communication skills
* have excellent spoken communication skills, both in person and over the phone
* be someone who thrives working in a high speed environment
* be excited about working as part of a small, tight-knit team

*Benefits*

Competitive salary
Share options
Company pension scheme
25 days holiday
Flexible working hours

*How to apply*

In applying for the role, please answer the following questions:

# Why have you applied for this role? (Max 100 words)
# What is your proudest achievement and why? ( Max 200 words)
# Please tell us about a company whose marketing you really admire. Why do you admire it?
# When would you be available to start work at Chaser?
# Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.title: We're hiring a REMOTE Marketing Developer at Podia: https://www.podia.com/marketing-developer Podia is a platform that makes it easy for creators to host ...
items.content:
We're hiring a REMOTE Marketing Developer at Podia: https://www.podia.com/marketing-developer

Podia is a platform that makes it easy for creators to host and sell online courses, memberships and digital downloads.

Work remotely on interesting growth challenges with an amazing team, and make an impact on thousands of users (and with your help, many thousands more).

++ Why work at Podia? ++

- Ultimate flexibility. We try to have some overlap time every day, but outside of that work whenever & wherever you work best.

- Extreme autonomy. No micro-managing here. You’ll be given high-level direction and then left to solve it the way you feel is best. You’re the expert!

- That said, the rest of the team is always ready to lend a hand — or even an ear if you just need to rubber duck some ideas.

- You get to work with a small, highly-talented team that has built — and continues to build — our business with care.

- Whether it’s fixes, small tweaks, or substantial features, we deploy often. There’s zero red tape to slow you down.

- We have a rapidly growing base of passionate customers, and a much larger market that your projects will be getting in front of. Your work will be seen and appreciated by many people.

- Competitive compensation. We want to hire the best people, and we’re ready to pay for them.

- (Paid for) annual retreats to spend time with the team and have fun together. This year’s retreat was in Portland, Maine!

Application details at https://www.podia.com/marketing-developer

items.content:
CargoMate Technologies is focused on bringing innovative efficiency to the container shipping industry. We are well funded and backed by one of the UK’s most successful tech accelerators, Entrepreneur First.

We’re developing a range of applications and technologies to record, monitor and analyse container ship cargo operations (i.e. the process of moving containers on and off a ship in port), to ensure ships depart early and consume less fuel on a voyage. Our long-term goal is to bring the widespread adoption of autonomous technologies to merchant ships.

We’re looking for an incredibly talented Marketing Manager to join our team and help us take our groundbreaking technology to market.

What you’ll do:

- Build CargoMate’s brand from the ground up, positioning us as a technology leader within container shipping
- Become an expert in container ship operations and the maritime industry
- Take responsibility for creating and delivering CargoMate’s marketing strategy
- Develop a programme of thought leadership including written and video content that adds value for container ship operators worldwide
- Liaise with conference and exhibition companies to manage sponsorship and exhibition opportunities
- Continuously optimise the CargoMate website to grow traffic and marketing qualified leads
- Create, run, and continually optimise CargoMate’s email marketing campaigns to convert and nurture leads
- Manage and grow CargoMate’s social media presence
- Proactively engage with industry and national press to earn coverage for CargoMate and our offering
- Work closely with the Sales team to create campaigns which open up conversations with strategic target accounts
- Create, run, and continually optimise CargoMate’s advertising campaigns

What we want:

- A bachelor's degree or equivalent professional experience
- 3 - 5 years experience in marketing, preferably within maritime or technology (or both)
- A practical understanding of inbound marketing and experience creating inbound campaigns focused on high quality written and video content
- An obsession with creating a great prospect experience and opening the door for conversations with members of our sales team
- Outstanding communication, interpersonal skills, and organisational skills, you should be a great writer, speaker, and listener
- Experience running and managing websites (we use Wordpress), setting up landing pages, and optimising them for conversions
- Experience of email marketing, PPC campaigns, and remarketing
- Experience working with Hubspot (our CRM and marketing system), or the willingness to quickly learn how to get the most out of it
- Flexibility - we’re constantly changing and evolving as a team and we want people who are willing to evolve with us
- The ability to challenge the status quo and continuously improve the way we work
- The ability to travel internationally and the desire to market to an international client base
- The intelligence to quickly become an expert in maritime operations, our technology, and marketing best practices; and the curiosity to continuously learn about the space as it develops.

What you’ll get:

- A competitive salary plus performance related bonus
- Support, mentoring, and the tools you need to become world class at what you do
- The chance to join an early stage business and shape its future
- A structured path to promotion, with the opportunity to lead a team as we scale
- The flexibility to work when you want to, and opportunity to undertake remote work once you’ve completed your first few months on the team

items.content:
Lead Product Manager


Manifold

 verified

Manifold is helping developers break free from the closed ecosystems of the cloud and into a more open, standards based community of services and APIs. Our marketplace connects applications, wherever they are hosted, to independent cloud services made by developers who care. Read more about our vision and funding here and check out our blog.

We are looking for a collaborative and highly technical lead product manager, with previous growth or startup experience. You will help us develop a rapid, iterative product cycle that uses customer development, experiments, data, and well-tuned intuition to build our product and our roadmap. You have creativity, rigor, confidence, and humility.

We believe that you'll love to work with the intelligent, kind, productive, and inspiring people who would be your colleagues. Many of us have strong ties to the open-source world, and have experience building tools at companies like Heroku, Red Hat, and Canonical.

Our first choice is that you work in our San Francisco office, but you can also join the half of us who work remotely within a few time zones of US Eastern, or the fine people in our home office in Halifax, Canada. We value diversity, equal opportunity, and supporting a remote-reliant distributed culture. Gender diversity is currently about one fifth.


What you'll do


* Connect directly with customers throughout the product development lifecycle. Participate in customer development, user research, user testing, and customer support.

* Collaborate deeply with fellow product managers, designers, engineers, marketing, and the executive team.

* Hypothesize, experiment, gather data, interpret, and act.

* Facilitate building our product vision and roadmaps, with alignment and enthusiasm from the team. Help make tough prioritization decisions, based on well-supported and well-reasoned rationales. Adjust dynamically based on new information.

* Communicate progress, changes, and setbacks clearly.

* Help lead a friendly, open culture that encourages us to support one another, challenge one another, and grow stronger together.

* Be a model and mentor for our other product managers.

* Be passionate about our mission, advocate for us, and help us envision Manifold's future.

* Be curious. Learn, practice, share, and improve our knowledge, tools, and processes.





What you'll need


* Deep empathy and respect for others, both customers and peers; combined with a backbone, intuition, and clearly reasoned opinions.

* Strong communication skills, with a team-centric and remote-reliant approach to discussion and decision-making that intelligently balances asynchronous and synchronous messaging.

* Strong technical ability. Ideally, some or all of the following describes you: you are proficient in one or more programming languages; you have experience and opinions about authorization systems; you like working in the terminal; or you are comfortable with modern development and deployment standards like Git, Docker, and Kubernetes.

* Strong analytical abilities, with experience in SQL, A/B and multivariate tests, metrics, and statistics.

* A real passion for design, usability, and detail.

* Deep and broad knowledge of the cloud developer tools space, or an ability to gain it quickly.

* Experience working with a distributed team, or an interest in learning.

* 5+ years of product management or equivalent experience.

* Nice to have: experience with marketplaces and/or SaaS products.





We're looking for


* Empathy

* Mentoring

* Product Management

* SQL

* Customer Development





A little bit about us

At Manifold, we help developers discover and use innovative tools and technologies; so you can focus on building, not managing, your applications. Each new cloud service we use today introduces complexity in the form of another bill, account to manage, credential to secure, and code to deploy.

Manifold allows you to build and offer cloud services to developers without having to worry about billing, identity, and credential distribution (An example of one such service: JawsDB).

We're a small, remote-reliant venture-backed company based in Halifax, Canada with an office in San Francisco. With a shared passion for making developers lives easier and our backgrounds reflect that, having worked at the likes of Red Hat, Heroku, Canonical, and Salesforce.


Are you interested?

We offer competitive compensation, equity opportunities, and excellent health care options, with additional perks such as a yearly professional development allowance. Please apply here, or by emailing gary@manifold.co.

See more jobs at Manifold

items.title: Sr Route Optimization Engineer
items.content:
### DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces. 

### REQUIREMENTS

* You love doing puzzles 
* You have serious math skills
* You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
* You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
* You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings


## BENEFITS 
#### Own Your Time
We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travelers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.  

#### Recharge Time
We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

#### Care For Yourself
You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

#### Focused Work
You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. 

#### Learn at your edges
We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.
And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

#### Clevertech Swag
And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over Slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team?  Check out [clevertech.careers].

Clevertech Culture Video

items.title: Marketing Manager (SaaS)
items.content:
Marketing Manager (saas)


Filestage

**About Us**

At [Filestage](https://filestage.io/) we believe that broken workflows poison teams with miscommunication, friction, and frustration. Our mission is to fuel creative teams with a rock-solid workflow. With our software, we empower people to produce great results together and build healthy and meaningful relationships at work.
Over 500 companies (and growing!) all over the world like Lufthansa, Can Tire or Jung von Matt benefit from happier and more productive employees with Filestage. We work hard to build great things together — and make time to celebrate our accomplishments.

**Your mission**
* **You own marketing.** You plan and execute the strategy to attract new people, win marketing qualified leads, and move users through each stage of the marketing funnel.
* **You lead all marketing activities.** You create marketing ideas, prioritize actions, implement tactics and ensure that we’re moving in the right direction.
* **You create a marketing machine.** You make sure that we grow steadily and win new clients by attracting quality leads. So you build, coach and grow the marketing team and you create the right environment to grow.

**You’re good at**
* **You’re a strategic thinker with a creative mindset and analytical skills.** You’re familiar with KPIs, can think outside of the box, enjoy networking with people, and like marketing strategy.
* **You’re passionate about marketing and growth.** You have professional work experience in marketing. Ideally B2B SaaS/Software. You’re an expert in online marketing, partnerships and/or content.
* **You take ownership.** You are filled with passion to take responsibility and to make things happen. You are an energetic self-starter who wants to make a tangible impact on a rapidly growing product and company.
* **You are a team player.** You understand that we can only be successful as a team. Like everyone else in our great team, you are fair, honest and respectful — and you are ready to have a lot of fun.
* **You are fluent in English.** German is a nice-to-have.

**This is what you get**
* **You have the freedom to work wherever you want.** Come work with us at our office in Stuttgart (Germany) or work remotely.
* **Your opinion matters and your work is valued.** You have the chance to make a difference.
* **You have a steep learning curve** by working hands-on together with highly talented minds.
* **Are you tired of useless meetings and slow decision making?** We have flat hierarchies, no bullshit meetings and we move fast.
* **You work with top-notch technologies and lean processes.** We use Slack, Asana, Hangouts — and of course Filestage — to communicate efficiently.

**What are you waiting for?**

To land this gig, please apply here: [https://goo.gl/forms/17spp5nu8Xg70mt72](https://goo.gl/forms/17spp5nu8Xg70mt72)

We look forward to your application!

See more jobs at Filestage

Visit Filestage's website

items.title: Growth Marketer
items.content:
At PassFort, we share a powerful vision to enable businesses & individuals to establish trust online.

We currently do this by giving businesses the tools they need to automate and digitalise the onboarding, verification and management of their customers - that means customers can be onboarded in real-time, without ever having met in person.

And this is just the beginning - our technology allows us to define what ‘trust’ means across the digital economy. Our long term aim is to create a single network where people and businesses can share their digital identity securely and interchangeably - whether they’re applying for a mortgage, listing on the stock market, or applying for a new job. We're transforming how trust is established online, in the same way that Salesforce transformed sales, Stripe transformed payments and AWS transformed DevOps.

What you’ll be doing

We’re looking for a Growth Marketer ready to bring their skills into an ambitious and fast-growing startup. Having just raised Series A funding, you’ll take ownership of building our customer acquisition strategy through organic and paid channels, increasing engagement and conversion.

This is our first Marketing hire and the role will be flexible and diverse. Reporting directly to the CEO, you’ll create and implement our SEO strategy, optimising copy and landing pages to drive website improvements, and performing ongoing keyword discovery. You’ll be responsible for executing tests and analysing results to identify trends and build a clear picture on who our audience is and how we can best target them (with best possible ROI). As someone driven by data, the acquisition funnel you create and optimise will be the foundation of our Growth Engine. We see SEO and PPC initiatives as a big initial investment to building out a category defining brand.

However we don’t want you to stop there. We also see this as a great developmental opportunity - we’re looking for you to grow with the business, so you’ll thrive on researching and experimenting with new channels to help pinpoint where we should focus our budget.

What we’re looking for

* Independent and organised self starter not afraid of meeting challenges head on
* You’ll be metrics focussed, able to track conversion rates and ROI, and make data driven decisions
* Love A/B testing anything you can think of;
* In-depth knowledge of SEO and Adwords
* Experienced using Google Analytics
* Experience of B2B marketing
* Experience with Google Tag Manager a plus
* Knowledge of other marketing channels and social a plus
* Experience working within or with small businesses / start-ups a plus

The Perks

* Equity! We want you to succeed as we do
* Great location - we’re central to three stations, and sandwiched between Brick Lane and Spitalfields market
* An annual learning & development budget to spend on professional or personal development, we’re invested in both
* Birthday off - relax and put your feet up
* Dental cover
* Access to Perkbox - discounts to services and products (and honestly it’s fantastic)
* Equally Enhanced Maternity/Paternity/Shared Leave pay
* Generous holiday entitlement
* Pension contributions - investing in your future is important
* Pick your own equipment and kit
* Biscuits… we’re a bit obsessed. We have a weekly ‘guest’ biscuit to broaden your biscuit horizons.
